intro: Urostigma gardnerianum, commonly known as the Gardner's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a hairy, branching stem. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, while its fruit is a segmented silique, typical of the Brassicaceae family. Urostigma gardnerianum is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
